00041 namespace CrissCross
00042 {
00043     namespace Data
00044     {
00045         typedef enum
00046         {
00047             STATUS_OK,
00048             STATUS_NULL_POINTER,
00049             STATUS_MEM_EXHAUSTED,
00050             STATUS_DUPLICATE_KEY,
00051             STATUS_KEY_NOT_FOUND,
00052             STATUS_KEY_TOO_LARGE
00053         } statusEnum;
00054 
00055         template < class dataType, class keyType > class RedBlackTree
00056         {
00057 
00058           public:
00059 
00060             typedef enum
00061             { BLACK, RED } nodeColor;
00062             typedef enum
00063             {
00064                 NODE_ITSELF_VISITED = 0,
00065                 LEFT_CHILD_VISITED,
00066                 ALL_CHILDS_VISITED
00067             } beenThereEnum;
00068 
00069             /*
00070                This is what a node looks like in this tree.
00071              */
00072             struct nodeType
00073             {
00074                 struct nodeType *left;    // Left child.
00075                 struct nodeType *right;    // Right child.
00076                 struct nodeType *parent;    // Supernode.
00077                 nodeColor color;        // Color of this node (Red/Black).
00078 
00079                 keyType id;                // This node's key (doesn't have to be unique).
00080                 dataType data;            // The actual record associated with this node.
00081                 beenThereEnum beenThere;    // Used for iterators.
00082                 struct nodeType *Left ()
00083                 {
00084                     return left;
00085                 }
00086                 struct nodeType *Right ()
00087                 {
00088                     return right;
00089                 }
00090 
00091                 nodeType(){};
00092                 ~nodeType(){};
00093             };
00094 
00095             nodeType *rootNode;
00096             nodeType *NULL_NODE;
00097 
00098             RedBlackTree ();
00099             ~RedBlackTree ();
00100             statusEnum insert ( keyType key, dataType rec );
00101             statusEnum deleteNode ( keyType key );
00102             statusEnum killNode ( nodeType * z );
00103             dataType find ( keyType key ) const;
00104             nodeType *findNode ( keyType key ) const;
00105             bool ValidNode ( nodeType * node ) const;
00106 
00107           protected:
00108             inline char *reallocKey ( char *pointer, char *a );
00109             inline int *reallocKey ( int *pointer, int *a );
00110             inline unsigned long *reallocKey ( unsigned long *pointer, unsigned long *a );
00111 
00112             inline char *newKey ( char *a );
00113             inline int *newKey ( int *a );
00114             inline unsigned long *newKey ( unsigned long *a );
00115 
00116             inline bool compLT ( const char *a, const char *b ) const;
00117             inline bool compLTEQU ( const char *a, const char *b ) const;
00118             inline bool compEQ ( const char *a, const char *b ) const;
00119 
00120             inline bool compLT ( const int *a, const int *b ) const;
00121             inline bool compLTEQU ( const int *a, const int *b ) const;
00122             inline bool compEQ ( const int *a, const int *b ) const;
00123 
00124             inline bool compLT ( const unsigned long *a, const unsigned long *b ) const;
00125             inline bool compLTEQU ( const unsigned long *a, const unsigned long *b ) const;
00126             inline bool compEQ ( const unsigned long *a, const unsigned long *b ) const;
00127 
00128             /*
00129                these are automatically called. no need to use them externally at all.
00130              */
00131             void killAll ( nodeType * rec );
00132             void killAll ();
00133 
00134           public:
00135             size_t size ();
00136             void getNext ( nodeType ** current );
00137 
00138             /*
00139                other old backward-compatible functions
00140              */
00141             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION ( find ) dataType GetData ( keyType key ) const;
00142             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION ( insert ) void PutData ( keyType key,
00143                                                              dataType rec );
00144             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION ( deleteNode ) void RemoveData ( keyType key );
00145             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION ( findNode ) nodeType *LookupTree ( keyType key );
00146 
00147           public:
00148             DArray < dataType > *ConvertToDArray ();
00149             DArray < keyType > *ConvertIndexToDArray ();
00150 
00151           protected:
00152             void RecursiveConvertIndexToDArray ( DArray < keyType > *darray,
00153                                                  nodeType * btree );
00154             void RecursiveConvertToDArray ( DArray < dataType > *darray,
00155                                             nodeType * btree );
00156 
00157           public:
00158             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION ( size ) int Size ();
00159             _DS_DEPRECATE_FUNCTION_N void Empty ();    // Ironically, an empty function, just here for straight compatibility.
00160             void Print ();            // Not deprecated, but still down here because it is a backwards-compatibility function.
00161 
00162           protected:
00163             void rotateLeft ( nodeType * x );
00164             void rotateRight ( nodeType * x );
00165             void insertFixup ( nodeType * x );
00166             void deleteFixup ( nodeType * x );
00167         };
00168     }
00169 }
